FuncDef:
The nat log session port-reservation command enables a device to record port reservation logs.
The undo nat log session port-reservation command disables a device from recording PCP port reservation logs.
This function is disabled in the NAT instance by default.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable a device to record PCP port reservation logs in a nat instance, run the nat log session port-reservation command. With this function enabled, if the port that the PCP client is to preempt is within the reserved port range, the device assigns the port and sends a flow log message. In the other situations, the device does not send such a log message. The CGN device then sends user log messages to implement the source tracing function.
If the reserved port range is configured and the PCP client uses a port within the allocatable port range of the PCP server, the PCP server does not send flow log messages.If the port used to send the common first packet, the device does not send flow log messages.If a flow table ages and a used port is within the reserved port range, the device does not send flow log messages.

Prerequisites
A flow log host has been configured and the flow log function has been enabled.
The port reservation function has been enabled.
